newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Lisbon bourse apathy due to rise of other markets.
newsitem.headline: Lisbon bourse apathy due to rise of other markets.

text.p: Apathetic trade on Lisbon bourse in recent sessions is explained by the rise of foreign markets and the forthcoming flotation of Deutsche Telekom, dealers said.

"The rise of foreign markets means investors are ignoring the local market in order to make more money elsewhere, and the flotation of Deutsche Telekom is cutting back trade in Portugal Telecom (PT)," said Jose Freire, analyst with broker Eser.
PT, traditionally one of the most liquid stocks on Lisbon bourse, could trade heavily again after the flotation of Deutsche Telekom due on November 18, analysts said.

Carlos Peixoto of broker Ascor-Dealer said many investors were studying the 1997 budget proposals before taking further decisions on share investments. Parliament is expected to pass the budget in a vote on December 11.
"I think the budget has weighed on share volume. Foreign investors are absent," Peixoto said.
Analysts said the announcement of third quarter bank results from next week could animate the Lisbon market.
